// Jason Blanchard

I am an instructional technologist fascinated by the ways in which technology, culture, and society are interrelated and co-constructed. How we learn information and express knowledge artifacts is at the core of this experience. By engaging with our media and exploring the technology structures around us, we can enrich our agency living in a networked world.

My academic and professional interests include ecological perspectives of learning, creativity & participatory Web culture, media literacy, open source processes, and organizational structures. I also participate in Web development projects, particularly in instructional technologies and civic hacking, using development frameworks including Drupal and Ruby on Rails.

You can find me on Twitter @about__blank, on an EDUCAUSE Constituent Group, or occasionally expressing my profound love for the works of David Foster Wallace over at the Wallace-l list serve. Or just email me: jas.blanchard[at]gmail[dot]com.
